Notes.Text:
This update includes Firefox 48.0.1 to fix a few regressions and a security issue:

  * Fix an audio regression impacting some major websites
  * Fix a top crash in the JavaScript engine
  * Fix a startup crash issue caused by Websense
  * Fix a different behavior with e10s / non-e10s on select and mouse events
  * Fix a top crash caused by plugin issues
  * Fix a shutdown issue
  * Fix a crash in WebRTC

- added upstream patch so system plugins/extensions are correctly
  loaded again on x86-64
- Fix for possible buffer overrun
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the yy_get_next_buffer function in Flex before 2.6.1 might allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involving num_to_read.
